data.title: ability to click on spatial subscene to select it
data.body:
After clicking at spatial subscene it should be selected. 
I got the initial idea on how to do this from some old code written by @TheoXD :+1: 
![click_select_spatial_subscene](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6129594/29133542-170ab7dc-7d34-11e7-8291-8e46ea336409.gif)

closes #2852

data.title: Node class provides signal for when moved in the node hierarchy
data.body:
There is already `enter_tree()` and `exit_tree()` signals, but there isn't any signal sent out when a node's position in the hierarchy is changed. This could be a useful feature for tools and procedural generation.

This might be something more for 3.1 or later seeing as how it would appear low on priority and involves modifications to a couple different places in main/node.h, and main/node.cpp (all the different cases where a node would be moving...have to do emit_signal(...) and creating / registering the signal, etc.).

EDIT:
I did notice that there are _notifications related to the situation such as NOTIFICATION_PATH_CHANGED. Perhaps it would be easier than I thought, just emitting the signal whenever that notification is sent out?

data.title: ScrollContainer doesn't react to its child's "sort_children()" naturally
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: 3.0.alpha1**


**Issue description:**
When the size of the child of a ScrollContainer node changes, the container will not update its scrollbars unless interacted with. The developer needs to use signals and manually call "queue_sort()" for the container.


**Link to minimal example project:**
[Test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1211935/Test.tar.gz)

data.title: Improves method bind's detecting of signarute types
data.body:
- Full automatic detection of the method signature types of method binds (except virtual method binds).
- It's no longer allowed to manually specify the type in the method name and argument names.
- If the method definition provides more arguments than the method actually has, it will result in an error and the method won't be added. Providing less arguments is not an error though, just a documentation issue (unless you like automatically-filled names like arg0).

**NOTE:** Virtual methods still require manually specifying the types. Don't forget to do so. I'll watching you :point_left: :eyes:

data.title: Editor Usability
data.body:
Hey, I didn't create this video (nor have any Unity experience) but I found this which highlighted a couple usability issues within Godot.

https://youtu.be/lRbefcsYDi4

* Difficulty selecting desired node
* Arrow keying through scene graph doesn't highlight current node
* Moving objects must be done per axis instead of on a plane
* Cannot drag/drop scenes directly into the editor view window
* No easy way to move objects large distances (i.e move to mouse position)

Understandably these are minor and all have easy workarounds within the engine if you know what you're doing, although given that one of Godot's main themes is ease-of-use I feel like some changes here to make some operations more intuitive wouldn't be a bad idea.

data.title: Documentation on how to use NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_*
data.body:
**bugsquad edit:** it turns out it's a documentation issue, in 3.0 we need to enable those notifications. More details here: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10200#issuecomment-321216920

-----------

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
1536cc438128fe4036fa7da5ec305513a781d3c8 (3.0 alpha)

**Issue description:**
NOTIFICATION_TRANSFORM_CHANGED and NOTIFICATION_TRANSLATION_CHANGED are not working for Spatial nodes. The bug was not present in 2.1 version

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download sample project
2. Open res://Issues/TransformChangedIssue/TransformChangedIssue.tscn
3. Run it
4. Translate object with `A` and `D` keys
5. Observe that there is no message in the console

**Link to minimal example project:**
[TransformChangedIssue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1210916/TransformChangedIssue.zip)

data.body:

i'm using this code:
```
    var imm = get_node("ImmediateGeometry")
    imm.clear()
    imm.begin(Mesh.PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP, null)
    imm.add_vertex(Vector3(0,0,0))

```

am i using it wrong or it is broken?

https://www.dropbox.com/s/f473mkcuq20yc2y/imm.zip?dl=0

data.title: Add map() function, for mapping values from a range to another
data.body:
I used [Processing](http://processing.org) and it contains a very useful function **map()**
it works like this: `var result = map(v, a,b, x,y)` you pass a value **v** which is between **a** and **b** and the function will return a number between **x** and **y**

ex: `var r = map(60, 20,100, 200, 240)` this will return **220**
or: `var g = map(0.43, 0,1, 0,255)`

From [here](https://forum.processing.org/one/topic/recreate-map-function.html) i saw that the actual java code used is:
`static public final float map(float value, float istart, float istop, float ostart, float ostop) {`
 `    return ostart + (ostop - ostart) * ((value - istart) / (istop - istart));`
`}`

I really love to add it myself but i never worked in other's codes and i don't know how and where to put it so please somebody add it .. its very usefull

Fixes #10160

data.title: tab_clicked signal for Tabs
data.body:
After solving https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/10051 it turns out there is no way to get information about user clicks at the active tab. 
This information might be needed to give ability to refocus content of the active tab, or to code such things like double click.

data.title: Use YXZ convention for Euler angles.
data.body:
As discussed in issues #1479 and #9782, choosing the up axis (which is Y in Godot) as the axis of the last (or first) rotation is helpful in practical use cases.
This also aligns Godot's convention with Unity, helping with a smoother transition for people who are used to working with Unity (issue #9905).

Internally, both XYZ and YXZ functions are kept, for potential future applications.

data.title: Instances of inner classe can't be load back with ConfigFile
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 alpha1 on Windows 10

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

There is a class named `MyClass.gd`. Instance of this class can be save and load back with `ConfigFile` but something wrong with the member `subObj ` which is an Instance of the inner class `SubClass`.

```gdscript
var name = "boy"
var age = 2
var subObj = SubClass.new()

class SubClass:
    var sex = "male"
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download the project below
2. Click "Save" button to save an instance of `MyClass` with `ConfigFile`
3. Click "Load" button to load the saved instance back from the saved file.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[ConfigFileBug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1210159/ConfigFileBug.zip)

Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia geforce 940M

I noticed wireframe mode does't turn particles into wireframe, are they supposed to be able to render this way?

data.title: 3D particles emission gets chunky if framerate is slowed down
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia geforce 940M

I noticed 3D particles emission became less random if the framerate isn't 60fps, giving this kind of artifact with 5000:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yEKJqWV1z-0&feature=youtu.be
If I reduce to something lower like 1000, the spawn pattern is back to random.

data.title: 3D particles are extremely laggy when seen close
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia geforce 940M

I made a failed attempt to generate a cloud using particles, but I noticed that if I watch them from a close distance, it starts to lag a lot, even with only 200 particles.
(I'd like to see how Godot perform to recreate a project I made with Unity 4 years ago: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vJgZz31GIWg)

Project: 
[ParticlesTest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1209774/ParticlesTest.zip)

data.title: There is no way to import BitmapFont in Godot 3
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3 form master, commit df573f5c3a76155842e43ea0dbab594e3944b114

**Issue description:**
While BitmapFont resource exist, there is no way to import TTF as BitmapFont 

There is one more use case I'd like to mention: importing image as BitmapFont. 
You can find a lot of bitmap fonts in form of textures in the internet. 
It could be nice to have way to import them. It's also easier to draw pixel font for your game than create vector ttf file. 

From what I see in the BitmapFont API, it could be done as plugin.

Example bitmap fonts from Playscii project: 
image:
![pico8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4397533/29097786-f66ad1c6-7c9b-11e7-86f3-3782c37674b6.png)
and character set definition:
[pico8.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1209768/pico8.txt)

data.title: 3D particles blink when set a velocity of 0
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia geforce 940M

When I set a velocity of 0 for particles in the process material, particles spawn and disappear one frame after, though lifetime is set to 1 second.

data.title: 3D particles cannot rotate
data.body:
Godot 3.0 alpha1
Windows 10 64 bits
nVidia geforce 940M

I tried various settings in ParticlesMaterial that are supposed to rotate the particles, but none of them worked. Angular velocity, orbit velocity, angle, none did anything when set to 1, 5, 60, even with randomness. Also, there doesn't seem to be a way to billboard them.

I am not sure what the 3 flags do by their names. They are all unchecked by default, but if I check some, they seem to affect rotation. However I don't understand how can rotation work if only one number is provided each time.

Also, is there a way to provide a mesh as emission shape?

data.title: Particles don't fire again when unmarking "One Shot"
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: 3.0.alpha1**


**Issue description:**
When unmarking the "One Shot" option in a Particles/Particles2D node, it will not start firing again unless either the scene is restarted, or setting off and on the Emitting opition.

data.title: Corrupt reflections in the material sample (Intel 620)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS: Windows 10 (build 1703)
Godot: df573f5c3a76155842e43ea0dbab594e3944b114 (issue is also apparent on the godot 3 alpha 1 along with additional artifacts due to #9970)
GPU: Intel HD Graphics 620 (driver 21.20.16.4590)

**Issue Description:**
There are visible artifacts (a grid effect) on reflections in the material sample:
![reflections](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30636555/29095051-7faf6f74-7c87-11e7-8833-db784f7b86d0.png)
